cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 410 mi south of Bermuda and 975 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating west-northwest, then northwest toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coast with inland movement into the Mid-Atlantic by the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern North Carolina coast near Cape Fear/Wilmington

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Storm Surge Watches from Edisto Beach, SC to the NC-VA border, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts from South Carolina through Virginia, with effects potentially spreading northward toward Delaware and southern New Jersey
weather_observation.wind: Gale-force gusts (34–45 kt) possible late Friday into Saturday; hurricane-force winds not expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible along Delaware Bay but surge >3 ft not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts if the core tracks farther north
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore likely beginning mid-week and persisting through the weekend
